column2: Thousands of people were left without power after a hailstorm hit Canberra on January 3. The Bureau of Meteorology issued a severe thunderstorm warning on Monday for giant hailstones, heavy rainfall, and damaging winds. This video, posted on Twitter by Maria Del’Amore, shows large hail stones falling in a back yard in Canberra. The storm primarily impacted the areas of Belconnen and Gungahlin, local news reported. Approximately 16,000 customers were left without power, Evoenergy said. Credit: Maria Del’Amore via Storyful
column4: Thousands Without Power as Canberra Hit by Storm

column2: Bipartisan legislation aimed at helping Americans build their retirement savings bogged down in 2021, but trade groups think its prospects are much better in the coming year.
column4: A Stalled Retirement Bill Could Be Passed in 2022. What It Will Mean for You.
